[ { "content": "

How to exit the program

  1. Complete any transaction you may have in progress.

  2. From the main menu choose File > Exit PostalMate. Alternatively, click the \"X\" button in the upper right corner of the screen.

  3. If the CashMate register is running, youll be asked if you want to exit that program also.

  4. If you havent done a daily backup yet, PostalMate will prompt you to do one. You are strongly urged to initiate a backup (click Yes).

Back to Table of Contents

Smart Notification Updates alerts you to when a new PostalMate update is available, it will automatically download, along with an Update Guide, and you will be notified by a PostalMate Update notification message in the lower right hand corner of your Windows Desktop.  If you ignore the notification, you will be reminded every four hours.

When you are ready to update, click on the message and choose \"Run Update\".
Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the update.  

It is highly recommended to perform a backup prior to running any updates.

Back to Table of Contents

PostalMate is a comprehensive automation solution for Mail and Parcel centers. The complete PostalMate system includes two major applications that work together:

  • PostalMate, a full-featured multi-carrier shipping program.

  • CashMate, a point-of-sale and mailbox management program.

In addition, there is System Utilities, a program used for maintenance.

The Basics

If youve never used PostalMate or Windows before, the topics listed below
can help you to get started. Click on a topic for details:

  • How to set up the system hardware

  • PostalMate Settings

  • PostalMate system menus

  • Navigation and other buttons

  • On-screen keypads

  • Connecting to the internet

  • PC Synergy Premium Services

Back to Table of Contents

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T00:01:06.254+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-08-08T20:03:40.619+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "b4d0adb7-0f91-4090-a2c0-4022f084960c", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T00:01:06.254+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": "Welcome to PostalMate ", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "Xc4yg99c/Welcome-to-PostalMate-", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2020-07-27T00:01:06.254+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

All of the settings and options necessary to initially configure PostalMate for use in your location are done from PostalMate Settings. Its also the main area to make changes at any time later. To get there, from the main menu go to Tools > PostalMate Settings.

Navigating between \"pages\"

PostalMate Settings has a wizard-style user interface, made up of a series of \"pages\", each containing settings for a particular part of the program.

Use the \"Next\" and \"Back\" buttons to move between pages sequentially. This is the best way to do you initial setup, because youll be guided through all the necessary areas, and in the right order. To go directly to a specific page, click on the page name on the left side of the screen.

On-screen hints

At the bottom of the screen is a \"Show hints\" check box. When checked (which is the default), by moving your mouse cursor over any are on a page, additional context-sensitive information and/or instructions will be displayed on the screen.

Saving information

When making entries, selections, or changes on any page, generally youll need to either save those changes or cancel them before you can leave that page. Pages with the Save/Cancel requirement have \"Save\" and \"Cancel\" buttons. If you make a change and attempt to leave that page without clicking Save or Cancel, youll be prompted to save or cancel.

PostalMate network

If your system is set up as a PostalMate network, the full range of settings can be done only on the Master workstation. Auxiliary workstations have access only to the settings that affect that particular station, such as scale settings. Setting up the PostalMate network itself is done from the System Utilities program.

Security

If you have security enabled in PostalMate, some pages are secure areas. Such areas require a password to access.

Back to Table of Contents

The \"system\" menus are accessed from the main menu bar at the top of PostalMate displays.

  • Most system options, operations and usage information may be accessed from the pull-down menus: File, Edit, Reports, Tools, and Help.

  • Most PostalMate setup options can be accessed by choosing main menu item Tools > PostalMate Settings.

  • PostalMate and CashMate each have some menu items that are not found in the other.

Note: Some key system-wide setups and tools are controlled from the System Utilities.
These include the Backup and Restore utilities, plus the Network and Security settings, among others. The System Utilities options are not accessible from the main PostalMate program.

Mouse and touchscreen users:

Click or touch on a \"pull-down\" menu in the program to display the options.

Keyboard users:

Use either the [Alt] or [F10] key to access the main menu bar.

  • Use the arrow key to select (highlight) individual menus and
    options. Press [Enter] to open the highlighted menu or screen option.

  • In the main shipping windows and dialogs, use the [Tab] key to
    move among the options.

Back to Table of Contents

Major features

  • Time Clock

  • UPS web services

Initial Setup

All setup to use PostalMate for the first time can be done from PostalMate Settings. To get there, choose main menu item Tools > PostalMate Settings.

A PostalMate network consists of:

  • A Windows network.  All computers (workstations) must be connected via a Windows network. Wireless networks are not supported or recommended.

  • One Master station.  This workstation contains a database shared by all workstations.

  • One or more Auxiliary station(s).  These have PostalMate installed, but rely on the Master and its database.

All workstations may share a report printer, but each station must have its own: label printer; receipt printer (if you use the POS); and electronic scale (optional).  Workstations that use the internet for shipping and other functionality may share a DSL or cable connection across the network.

Below is the basic process for getting enabling a PostalMate network.

1. Get your Windows network ready

A peer-to-peer Windows network must setup and working.  PC Synergy is not involved in setting this up.  If you're not up to doing this on your own, you may wish to hire a qualified computer technician.

Note: The balance of the steps are done from the System Utilities program.  It has its own Help system with more detail about network settings.

2. Designate the Master station

Determine which computer will be the Master. This should be your fastest computer, with the most memory (RAM).  On that computer, do the following

  1. Make sure that PostalMate and/or POS are not running.

  2. Run System Utilities.

  3. From the System Utilities main menu, choose Tools > Network Station Settings.

  4. Under \"Change to\", click on Master.  You'll be prompted to enter a name.

  5. Enter a name or description for the computer, or accept the default, and click OK.

  6. Click Close to exit System Utilities.

3. Add Auxiliary station(s)

Now you'll be adding one or more computers to the PostalMate network.

  1. Make sure that PostalMate and/or POS are not running.

  2. Run PM System Utilities.

  3. From the System Utilities main menu, choose Tools > Network Station Settings.

  4. Under \"Change to\", click on Auxiliary.  You'll be prompted to enter a name.

  5. Enter a name or description for the computer, or accept the default, and click OK.

  6. You'll see a screen that lists all computers on your Windows network, using their Windows computer names.  Select the Master computer and click OK.

  7. Click Close to exit System Utilities.

  8. Repeat these steps for each station that you wish to add as an Auxiliary.

Now your PostalMate network should be ready for use, and you can run PostalMate on any all workstations, as long as the Master workstation is running.

335544721 - Statement Failed to Prepare - #Network Issue (usually on aux)

  • check services to ensure Firebird services running

  • if unable to open PMU, go into REGEDIT > H KEY LOCAL MACHINE > SOFTWARE > WOW64 > PCSYNERGY > POSTALMATE > CURRENT VERSION > = right click on WORKSTATION ID > MODIFY > = change to 0 >> click on FB folder > right click on SERVER >MODIFY and change to LOCALHOST

  • *Make exceptions in Windows Firewall (inbound/outbound) PORT 3050

  • * if anti-virus is controlling Windows Defender Firewall (WDF), they will need to maintain by adding exceptions in chosen Firewall

  • Go back into PostalMate Utilities and re- network station back to auxiliary

  • Go through PostalMate Settings once an auxiliary 1.) Carrier Setup > USPS if they use they Dymo printer 2.) Package receiving = label printer 3.) Drop-off settings 4.) Label settings = assign all labels that show a number int the QTY fields 5.) Station settings = enable and set the report printer (you can ask if the want to scale PM)

  • Open CashMate and assign the receipt printer

  • Confirm if the run credit cards though a CashMate interface and setup (if needed) and test before logging off

335544333 - Firebird Consistency Check - Often caused by power outage, pc shut down while PM open, corrupt data for various reasons (bad backup)

  • Try opening PMU and restore a backup prior to the error message (Master) / if Auxiliary, try to run the last update again and choose repair

  • If PMU doesn't open, do clean uninstall/reinstall and restore a backup prior to the error

335544569 - Dynamic SQL Error - corrupt data (sometimes related to QUOTES feature or added mail name)

  • Generally you will need to uninstall/reinstall PostalMate and restore a backup, but if they have done sales prior to the error, you can try taking database out and replacing once reinstalled (doesn't always work)

  • Remove mail names and re-add

335544321 - Arithmetic exceptions, numeric overflow or string truncation - Long address for domestic or international entries

  • Nothing we can do about that, they will have to shorten or abbreviate if they can, otherwise highlight the important info

335544345 - Database Deadlock - concurrent update

  • Reboot all PM pcs simultaneously

335544344 - I/O error during \"ReadFile\" operation for file \"C:\\PROGRAMDATA... Error while trying to read from file Data error (cyclic redundancy check).

  • Hard drive failure or bad sectors.

335544335 - Database file appears corrupt ()

bad checksum error on database page 48719

  • Clean uninstall/reinstall and restore the last backup

335544879 - This error occurred when adding a customer

Closing and restarting PM seemed to have resolved the issue

This screen is contains some miscellaneous shipping-related settings. These settings are only for this workstation. Settings in this area must be done separately on each station if networked.

Internet shipping

These check boxes determine whether or not FedEx online shipping, DHL online shipping, UPS web services and/ or LSO online shipping are enabled on this computer.

  1. Make sure that youve signed up for Premium Services with PC Synergy.

  2. Make sure that youve registered (or subscribed) with the carrier. This is done from each of the carriers Setup pages in PostalMate Settings.

  3. Check the box next to each internet shipping service that you wish to enable on this station. If any are grayed out, they are unavailable to your Store Group.

Shipments to POS register

The options here control how PostalMate shipping charges and Hold/Recall functions will be handled with the POS.

  • This station only (fully automatic): Integrates PostalMate shipping charges with the POS on this workstation only. The Hold feature is enabled for both programs on this station, and shipping charges will be brought into POS automatically when you choose the POS Register/Mailbox button.

  • No Station (POS not used): should be selected only if you don't have or want to use POS together with the shipping program. The POS Register/Mailbox button will be disabled in PostalMate.

  • Network (Hold, for Recall at any station): This option is enabled only if you are using a PostalMate network, and have it set up. Choose this setting if you want to allow the Recall function to be used from any station for any transaction on \"Hold\" anywhere on the network. Shipping charges will be brought over automatically to POS on Hold/Recall.

Background color

This setting is for cosmetic purposes.

For a more professional look, you can conceal what is displayed behind PostalMate, using a background color of your choice:

  1. Select the desired color from the drop-down list.

  2. Click Save and close PostalMate Settings.

  3. If you havent already, maximize  the PostalMate. The entire display will be filled, using the background color that you selected.

Size of transaction screens

To make shipping and CashMate screens easier to read and use, you can scale up (enlarge) PostalMate and POS transaction screens (for shipments and register sales) relative to your monitor size, as long as you have your monitor resolution set higher than 800x600.

In blue - your Current monitor resolution (for this station) is displayed. You should make sure that you are using the optimum monitor resolution in Windows. Click on the Current monitor resolution blue link to adjust settings as needed.

From the drop-down list, select the desired scaling. You may wish to experiment with different sizes.

Click Save to apply the change and you will be prompted to re-start PostalMate. Click OK and PostalMate will close and re-open with the applied scaling.

How to get to Station Settings

From the PostalMate main menu, choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Station Settings.

PostalMates Backup feature allows you to copy your system data to a CD, flash drive, or other high capacity media for safekeeping. This is called \"backing up the system\".

For details about backing up PostalMate/CashMate files, click on a topic:

  • How to do a system backup

  • When you should do backups

  • Backup methods and media

  • Your critical PostalMate data

Note: In the PostalMate Network environment, run the Backup feature from the Master Workstation. You do not need to run this feature on Auxiliary workstations.

How to do a system backup

The safest, most secure backup method is to portable media (CD or other media). This way, it's easy to keep a copy in a secure location or even off-site. The backup will include all critical data from your PostalMate and
CashMate files. The PostalMate data files will be compressed (zipped up) in one file. This way, only a small part of the space normally required by these files will be needed on the target disk

  1. Choose the OK button to begin the backup.

  2. Select the drive, filename, and folder where you want the backup to go.

  3. The default file name is based on the date and version. For example if the backup was made on a Thursday, and the version is 8.5.1, then the backup file name would be \"PMBackup_Thu_11.5.1.zip\"

  4. Since there are seven (7) days in the week, this would allow you a maximum of seven PostalMate backups on each CD or other backup file location that you specify.

  5. Click Save.

  6. The message \"Copying and compressing files\" will display, along with the names of the files as they are processed. When the backup is finished, you will see the words \"Backup complete\" displayedyou may close the Backup Data dialog at this time.

Store your backup media in a safe location. If you ever have a computer problem, a virus, a power surge, or other condition that can damage or destroy your data, youre protected.

Also, it's a good idea (and easy) to keep another backup copy in a safe, off-site location. This helps protect your PostalMate data against unforeseeable events.

Automatic backups

In the event that regular backups are not performed, PostalMate will automatically perform a backup upon exiting the program after the 6th day of not backing up. The auto-backups are saved locally on the computer in the Documents folder under PostalMateAutoBackups.

When you should do backups

The more recent your backup, the more \"covered\" you are against loss. If you have a computer failure and you havent backed up the system for a week, then youll lose the past weeks data. So, be sure to run the back up every day.

  • Backups protect your business against the possible loss of the valuable data generated and stored in PostalMate.

  • A backup copies history, system settings, prices and rates, carriers, products, departments, customer account and mailbox information onto the backup media.

Backup methods and media

Backing up your data is easy and fast. Youll need a high capacity media device, such as an external hard drive, network location or a flash drive.  Its a good idea to keep two sets of backup media on hand, and alternate them daily. This way, youre double-covered against damage or loss of the backup disk(s).

Your critical PostalMate/CashMate system data includes:

  • Account history

  • Carrier information

  • Customer information

  • Prices and shipping rates

  • Products and departments

  • Register, AR, and sales tax settings

  • Register transaction history

  • Shipping history

  • Ship To (consignee) information

  • System settings

If you ever have a computer problem that damages or destroys this data, then you can use your backup disks to restore the data.

How to get to the \"Backup Files\" dialog

If you are attempting to close PostalMate or CashMate, choose \"Yes\" when
prompted by the system to run the backup.

At any other time you may pro-actively backup your PostalMate files in the System Utilities program. From the System Utilities main menu, choose Back up PostalMate.

You have many options for setting your retail shipping rates (the rates you charge to your customers) in PostalMate.  In most cases, you can also set your wholesale rates (your actual costs) to reflect whatever discounts you may be receiving from the carriers, so that you can track your profits accurately.

Setting base retail shipping rates

Base shipping rates, are essentially the 'rate charts' for each service, with dollar amounts for each zone/weight combination.  PostalMate stores four rate levels for each of these; in this section only retail is addressed.

  • Setting rates globally. This is the easiest and simplest way to set your rates across any or all services in PostalMate.

  • Setting rates using formulas and other techniques.  This is a little more work, but gives you much more control.  On a per-service basis you can apply formulas to create custom rate charts that exactly meet your needs by giving you complete control.  You can even edit individual rates.  

Setting other shipping-related rates

PostalMate also manages rates for insurance, surcharges, and add-ons.  Click on any topic below for rate-setting information about these.

  • Setting Add-On Rates

  • Setting Insurance Rates

  • Setting Surcharge Rates

Setting your wholesale rates with carrier discounts

Wholesale rates are the rates that you actually pay to the carrier. Sometimes they are the same as the \"list\" rates, but most stores have special rate plans for one or more of the private carriers, often based on shipping volume.  These are often called \"tiers.\"  PostalMate supports many of these plans, and allows you to easily apply their discount structures to your wholesale rates.

What happens after a carrier rate change?

Most carriers change their rates on an annual basis, sometimes more frequently.  When this happens, you'll normally be advised that a new PostalMate version is available for download on the PC Synergy website; this is covered by your annual support fees; for an additional charge, you can also get the update via CD.  Running the update is the firs step; you'll normally want to then load the rates into your charts and set new retail rates:

  • Loading rates after a carrier rate change.  The update will copy the new published rates onto your computer, but loading them into your charts is a separate activity.

  • Using the Quick Rate-Setting Utiliies to re-establish your wholesale and retail rates. This utility makes is an easy-to-use wizard that can: a.) Apply any discount tier or plan that the new published rates to create new wholesale rates; and b.) apply your preivous profit margins to the new rates, to create new retail rates.

About rates for Additional Carriers

\"Additional Carriers\" are any that have been added by you in PostalMate (in other words, not DHL, FedEx, UPS or USPS).

  • Published, wholesale and retail rates for additional carriers are supported by you, and by your arrangements with those carriers.  PC Synergy does not provide these rates.

  • Zoned rate structures for Additional Carriers are not supported in PostalMate. Thus, if an Additional Carrier service has a zoned rate structure, youll need to add a separate service for each zone.

  • There are no Quick Rate-Setting Utilities for additional carriers, however most of the other rate-setting features in PostalMate can also be used for setting rates for additional carriers.

 Back to Table of Contents

Sidebar Settings is where you can turn on or off gadgets or create new custom gadgets to display on your PostalMate Sidebar.

Check the box \"Start Sidebar with PostalMate\". This will launch the Sidebar application automatically each time you open PostalMate.

Sidebar Gadgets

  • Calculator: A simple on-screen calculator for any purpose.

  • Converter: A full featured conversion tool that converts weight, length, volume and more from one unit of measure to another. Also converts fractions to decimals and vice versa.

  • PC Synergy Twitter and Facebook feeds. Keeps you abreast of the latest tweets and posts from us.

  • Custom Slideshow: Displays one or more images from the specified folder on your system. If you have a customer-facing monitor, this is a great way to display graphics-based marketing messages.

    • Put one or more graphics into any Windows folder.

    • Below Custom, highlight \"Slideshow\" and click \"Edit\".

    • Click \"Browse\" and specify the folder you used in step 1.

    • Optionally, you can check \"Show PostalMate/POS
      during transactions\".*

    • Click OK to save your settings.

  • Custom URL: Create one or more gadgets to display web pages of your choice.

    • Below Custom, click Add.

    • Enter a name for the new gadget.

    • Enter any valid URL (web page address).

    • Optionally, you can check \"Show PostalMate/POS
      during transactions\".*

    • Click OK to save your settings.

*Showing PostalMate/POS transaction (Twinview)

If you have a separate customer-facing monitor, you can display marketing
graphics or a web page to your customers. When you begin a shipping or POS
transaction it will display the PostalMate and/or POS Register screens until the
transaction is completed.

How to get to Sidebar Settings:

Open the PostalMate Sidebar from your main PostalMate screen by clicking Tools > Show Sidebar. From the Sidebar, select Tools > Settings.

Depending on the characteristics a package or its destination, in some cases a carrier may apply extra charges to a shipment. These are referred to as Surcharges. Some of the surcharges supported by PostalMate ares:

  • Additional Handling

  • Delivery Area Surcharge

  • Saturday Pickup and Delivery

  • Fuel Surcharge

Surcharges are distinct from Add-Ons, which are optional and are selected from the Package Details screen.

In some cases, carrier-termed \"surcharges\" are handled in PostalMate by creating separate carrier services with distinct rate charts, which include the \"surcharges.\" An example of this is UPS Early A.M. So in PostalMate, Early A.M. is not really a Surcharge as defined in this topic.

How PostalMate applies surcharges

Because surcharges generally arent optional (in contrast to Add-Ons), and the rules can be complex and confusing, in most cases PostalMate does all the work for you. Based on information youve entered about the package, rates displayed in the Rate Comparison screen automatically include any applicable surcharges, and that fact will be indicated on-screen.

Saturday Pickup and Delivery are handled slightly differently, as they are in fact optional. When available, the Saturday options are displayed as separate carrier service choices on the Rate Comparison screen, and the surcharges will be included in the displayed rates.

A note about Extended Area Surcharge and USPS Non machinable surcharge

Conceptually, Extended Area Surcharge is, as the name indicates, a surcharge, as its not really optional either a package qualifies for this or it doesnt. In PostalMate, however, Extended Area Surcharge is currently handled as an Add-On. When using Online Commitment Updates (and the address was entered correctly) Extended Area Surcharges will be added automatically. In these cases, the Extended Area Surcharge will not display as a choice on the Add-Ons screen (this means the charge has already been applied). If the Extended Area Surcharge option displays on the Add-Ons screen and you have verified with the carrier that it should be added, check the box to add the charge.

A note about Fuel Surcharges

Unlike other surcharges, a Fuel Surcharge is applied across all rates for a given carrier, regardless of package characteristics, and is therefore a slightly different model. PostalMate does support Fuel Surcharges.  Wholesale rates for fuel surcharges are updated monthly via eUpdate.

Setting rates for Surcharges

You have control over what you charge to your customers for Surcharges (the retail rate), regardless of what the carrier charges to you (the wholesale rate). This is done from PostalMate Settings, on the \"Surcharge Rates\" page.

Back to Table of Contents

The PostalMate sidebar is a customizable \"gadgets\" window that can show on the screen alongside PostalMate. This is a separate window that contains one or more useful \"gadgets\" that you can choose from.

The sidebar is mostly designed to occupy the extra space available on widescreen monitors, and/or to appear on separate customer facing monitors. The sidebar can be used on any PostalMate system.

  1. Start: to launch the Sidebar, select Tools > Show Sidebar from PostalMate's main menu.

  2. Position: Drag the Sidebar into whatever position you like. It can \"snap\" to either side of PostalMate's main screen, or to an edge on the monitor. You can drag it to a second monitor if you have one.

  3. Add or subtract gadgets:  Click on the corresponding button(s) at the top, or select/deselect them from the \"View\" menu.

  4. Save: Once you have the Sidebar set up to your liking, choose menu item Tools > Save current
    layout.

Sidebar Gadgets

  • Calculator: A simple on-screen calculator for any purpose.

  • Converter: A full featured conversion tool that converts weight, length, volume and more from one unit of measure to another. Also converts fractions to decimals and vice versa.

  • PC Synergy Twitter and Facebook feeds. Keeps you abreast of the latest tweets and posts from us.

  • Custom Slideshow: Displays one or more images from the specified folder on your system. If you have a customer-facing monitor, this is a great way to display graphics-based marketing messages.

  • Custom URL: Create one or more gadgets to display web pages of your choice.

  • Showing PostalMate/POS transaction
    (Twinview): If you have a separate customer-facing monitor, you can display marketing graphics or a web page to your customers. When you begin a shipping or POS transaction it will display PostalMate and/or POS Register screens until the transaction is completed.

How to get to the PostalMate Sidebar:

From the PostalMate main menu, choose Tools > Show Sidebar.

Back to Table of Contents

The hardware devices to be used with your PostalMate system need to be plugged into the appropriate ports on the computer. After the necessary physical connections are made, youll need to go to PostalMate Settings and make the proper assignments on the \"Labels\" and \"Scales\" pages..

Click on a topic below for specific information:

  • Connecting the printers

  • Connecting the scale

  • Connecting the receipt printer and cash drawer

  • Connecting the bar code scanner

  • After you are done connecting . . .

System hardware

Your system hardware may include one or more of the following:

  • Desktop laser or inkjet printer for reports

  • Zebra  4 x 6 label printer (required for most shipments)

  • Scale

  • Bar code scanner

  • Receipt printer and cash drawer

CAUTION: All hardware connections should be made with the computer and all peripheral devices unplugged and turned off.

Connecting the printers

The Zebra label printer needs to be physically connected to either a parallel printer port (LPT) or a Universal Serial Bus (USB) port on the computer.

  • See PostalMate's Hardware Requirements for a list of supported printers and hardware.

Connecting the 4 x 6 inch label printer

Detailed instructions are included with your label printer, but here are the
basics:

  1. Plug the printer cable into the Eltron printer.

  2. Plug the other end of the printer cable into the LPT1 port. If your system has one or more USB ports, you may instead connect the printer to a USB port on the computer or on a USB hub connected to the computer. A USB hub will allow you to connect and manage multiple USB-compatible devices.

  3. Plug the small end of the power cord into the printer.

  4. Plug the other end of the power cord into an appropriate power outlet.

Connecting the Reports printer

  1. Connect the reports printer cable to any parallel port (LPT2 or LPT3), or USB port if ones available. You will need the correct cable or adapter for the USB connection.

  2. Plug the power cord into an appropriate power source.

Connecting the scale

Depending on the model of scale you have, connect it to either a serial (COM) port, or a USB port, in order to interface with PostalMate. It must be a model compatible with PostalMate..

  1. Plug the scales interface cable into an available serial (COM) or USB port on the computer. Be sure to tighten the connector screws.

  2. Level the scale. After the scale is placed in a permanent work location, remove the platter by pulling straight up. You will see a bubble level. Turn the scales adjustable feet until the bubble is centered, then replace the platter.

  3. Plug the power cord into an appropriate power outlet.

Connecting the receipt printer and cash drawer

Connect the cash drawer and receipt printer to any other unused parallel port
(this will normally be LPT2 or LPT3), like this:

  1. Connect one end of the parallel cable to the receipt printer and
    the other end to an LPT port on the computer.

  2. Plug the cash drawer into the receipt printer. The thin gray
    cable on the back of the cash drawer goes into a small socket on the bottom of
    the receipt printer.

  3. Plug the receipt printers power cord into a power
    outlet.

Connecting the bar code scanner

Detailed instructions are included with the bar code reader, but here are the
basics:

  1. Plug the scanner into an available USB port.

After youre done connecting your hardware

After all PostalMate system devices have been connected, and after the printers are set up in Windows:

  1. Open PostalMate and go to main menu item Tools > PostalMate Settings. Choose Label Settings and Scale Settings to specify where you connected your scale and label printer(s).

Back to Table of Contents

There are numerous generic and unique buttons in PostalMate.

  • Generic Windows buttons allow you to minimize, maximize, restore, reveal or hide a screen.

  • Other system buttons allow you to move forward or backward through different screens; \"Cancel\" a transaction or changes to a screen; \"Close\" a screen; \"OK\" (accept) current changes; and \"Save\" changes.

  • Each shipping window and dialog in PostalMate has its own Help button. Use the Help button to get Online Help for the current display.

  • There are also unique buttons for essential shipping operations.

Minimize/Maximize/Close buttons

When you start PostalMate, youll see the standard Minimize/Maximize/Close buttons in the upper right corner of the PostalMate screen.

  • Click or touch on the middle button to optimize the window. Use the left button to minimize (hide) the window.

  • Use the [x] button to close the window.

PostalMate task bar button

When PostalMate is minimized and you want to restore the display, touch or click on the program button in the Windows task bar.

Navigation buttons

The system navigation buttons allow you to move forward and back through the shipping transaction windows and to get Help.

\"Cancel\" button

You may use the Cancel button to abort the current shipping transaction.

The \"Cancel\" button may also be used to exit certain windows, such as the \"Edit\" dialogs, without saving any changes.

\"Back\" button

The Back button allows you to go back to the previous screen.

If the Back button is grayed out (not useable), it means that you cant go back to the previous display.

\"Next\" button

Use of the Next button allows you to go forward to the next display in the sequence.

If more information is needed or action needs to be taken in the current display, then the >> Next button will be grayed out.

\"OK\" button

Use the OK button to accept the displayed information.If any changes have been made, they will be saved.

\"Close\" button

Use the Close button to <Exit> a displayed dialog. This action does not, by itself, save any changes you have made.

\"Save\" button

In PostalMate dialogs with a Save button, usually there's also a Close button. In the Rate setting dialogs, for example, using the Save button allows you to save multiple rate changes as you make them, without closing the dialog.

\"Send\" button

On some screens related to internet activities, you'll see the Send button. This is used to transmit information electronically.

Operational buttons

  • Click the \"Ship a Package\" button to ship a package or carrier-branded packaging.

  • Click the \"Mail a Letter\" button to mail a letter through the post office.

Back to Table of Contents

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T00:06:19.796+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-08-08T20:15:15.332+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "5f956dc9-876b-49e4-a486-c193b2d73331", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T00:06:19.796+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": "Navigation and other Buttons (overview) ", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "7idoGMzi/Navigation-and-other-Buttons-overview-", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2021-01-28T00:06:19.796+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

PostalMate supports the ability to insure packages via a provider other than the shipping carrier, generally at lower rates. This is called \"Alternate Insurance\" in PostalMate, but is sometimes referred to by some as \"third-party insurance.\"

Some highlights of the Alternate Insurance feature are:

  • You may use the insurance provider of your choice. PostalMate will produce an Alternate Insurance Report, which is used to calculate and remit your premium payments (this is typically done on a monthly basis). The report format has been approved by several major providers.

  • Every carrier service in PostalMate can be set to use alternate insurance. If you provider will insure a given service, PostalMate will handle iteven if the shipping carrier wont insure its own service.

  • Variable rating is accommodated. For providers that charge different rates for different services (i.e., one rate for FedEx and another for USPS), you can set up as many \"rate groups\" as needed; then you simply assign each service to the appropriate rate group.

  • Alternate insurance can be overridden, or changed, for any package. By default, PostalMate will normally assign all but the first $100 of declared value to the alternate provider. However, you can easily reallocate some or all of it to the shipping carrier (the \"primary\" provider).

  • \"Approval\" limits are supported. Some providers may require you to contact them if the declared value exceeds a certain amount. If so, PostalMate will remind you to do so when appropriate.

Back to Table of Contents

Freight bookings are processed via an external system, typically a website. Enabling Freight in PostalMate allows you to charge for the freight shipment easily as well as to keep record of it in PostalMate. Follow these steps to turn
on Freight and set your defaults.

Enabled

Check the box \"Enabled\".

Default external booking system

You may use more than one freight booking system. Use the drop-down menu to
select the default (the one you may use most often).

If you use a booking system that is not available in the list, select the Add button. Enter the name of the booking system and the URL (web address) that you use to for that company.  The URL will display on the Freight screen when that company is selected. Use the Edit button to make changes to a company name or URL if needed. To delete a booking system from the list, choose Delete.

Default freight carrier

Using the drop down menu, select your default freight carrier. This is the carrier that you would use most often. You can choose another freight carrier at the time of entering the freight shipment.  Use the Add button to enter a freight carrier that you use, but is not in the list.

If you use an alternate insurance carrier for freight shipments, you can assign the alternate insurance to the freight carrier by selecting the Edit button. On this screen, select the alternate insurance rate group from the drop down menu and click OK.

To delete a freight carrier, select the freight carrier you wish to remove and choose Delete.

Default margin for retail

When recording a freight shipment in PostalMate, you can enter in your cost and PostalMate will calculate the retail charge based on the margin or dollar amounts you have entered.  These values can be changed at the time of entering
the freight shipment.

Enter in the default percent markup, or dollar markup, you wish to use for freight shipments. Do this for Base Shipping, Additional services and Insurance.

Department

Selecting a department for Shipping and Insurance tells PostalMate which department that these sales will go to in the POS. Use the drop down menu to select the appropriate department for both Shipping and Insurance.

Default rating mode

Full view allows you to view and edit the default margin for base shipping cost, additional services, and insurance at the time of recording the freight shipment. If you want this option, then check-mark Full
view.

How to get to Freight Settings

From the PostalMate main screen, choose Tools > PostalMate Settings and select Shipping Settings on the left. Choose the Freight tab.

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T00:36:42.268+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-10-14T20:51:26.763+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "ffdb087b-2eec-47f7-a32d-2f9bf3ea3edd", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T00:36:42.268+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": "Freight Settings", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "XT4Kkp5T/Freight-Settings", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2020-07-27T00:36:42.268+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

FedEx International Ground Canada and FedEx International Express can be processed online in PostalMate.  Enter customs information and a ramp-ready label is generated, along with a commercial invoice.

  1. Begin the shipment normally. Note that a Customer must be linked to the shipment (this is a FedEx requirement)

  2. After you select a FedEx International Express or FedEx International Ground Canada service on the Rate Comparison screen, you will be prompted for customs-related information.

  3. Fill out the Customs Declarations form with all of the required information. The FedEx Conditions of Contract must be checked, in order to proceed.

  4. Complete the shipment as normal and a shipping label will print along with one or two additional
    \"International Air Waybill\" (AWB) labels. The quantity will depend on the country. These replace the old manually-completed air waybills. Leave the backing on these labels and place them in the pouch, along with three signed and dated copies of the Commercial invoice (an extra invoice copy is printed for you
    or your customer to keep.)

FedEx International Express

Your Customer is the shipper of record. Unlike with other services, for FedEx International Express shipments, your customer is the official shipper of record, not your store, although the shipment will be billed to your stores FedEx account.  Thats the reason that FedEx wants your customer to approve of the customs-related information entered on their behalf, and on the Conditions of Contract. You can still file claims on your customers behalf.

Out-of-Delivery Area surcharge is now applied
automatically. In prior versions of PostalMate, the Out-of-Delivery Area (ODA) surcharge (also known as Extended Area Surcharge) was implemented as an add-on in PostalMatemeaning that it was up to you to determine whether or not it
should be applied. Now the surcharge is applied automatically when appropriate, depending on the destination address.

Note: There may be rare situations in which you know that the ODA surcharge should be applied, but it doesnt get applied automatically (for example due to an incorrect address spelling). In that case you can apply the charge manually as an add-on in the Package Details screen. Always take extra care to ensure that address information is spelled
properly.

FedEx International Ground Canada

This is an online service (with no offline option). As with other online international services in PostalMate, all customs-related information can be entered directly into PostalMate, a ramp-ready label is generated, and optionally a Commercial Invoice can be created and printed. A manually-completed Air Waybill isnt used.

A unique aspect of this service is that based on the value of dutiable goods, FedEx may add a Clearance Entry
Fee (C.E.F.), and a C.E.F. Tax to the shipping rate. To ensure a meaningful comparison between services, when the package destination is Canada, you can enter a dutiable value prior to comparing rates so that all charges are
included. This is done in the same places as where a declared value for insurance is entered.

Please note: Youll enter the dutiable value in U.S. dollars, however the C.E.F. is based on Canadian dollars, and the exchange rate continuously fluctuates. PostalMate checks the exchange rate on a daily basis for calculating the C.E.F., however in some cases it may not exactly match the exchange rate FedEx uses to calculate the C.E.F.

You cannot mark up the C.E.F. or C.E.F. Tax in PostalMate, so these are pass-through charges to your customers.

The C.E.F. and C.E.F. tax charges are broken out on the customers CashMate register receipt, the Package History
screen, and on the FedEx Ground Manifest Detail Report.

This is where basic setup for USPS is done in PostalMate.

USPS in PostalMate: Check this box if you offer USPS; otherwise, leave un-checked, and USPS will not appear on PostalMate screens.

Endicia Label Server

  1. Below \"Online shipping interface\" select Endicia: Label Server.

  2. Select the Endicia Settings button for more setup options.

Endicia Printable Postage

Endicia Printable Postage allows you to print postage stamps through the Letter via Post office screen. Printable Postage is designed to work with the Dymo 400 and Dymo Twin Turbo printers, and Dymo Stamps postage label stock 30915.

  1. Below \"Endicia Printable Postage\" choose Endica: Label Server from the drop-down menu. Click Save.

  2. Choose the button Printable Postage settings.  

  3. Checkmark \"Test mode\" to print test stamps. Remember to un-check test mode when testing is complete.

  4. Choose you Buy mode default (Menu, Prompt or Auto) and Default purchase amount.

  5. Below Printer Settings, select your DYMO label printer from the drop down menu.

Wholesale Rates

If you ship USPS online in PostalMate (using the interface with Endicia Label Server) you are entitled to discounted USPS rates for certain mail classes. You can set your Wholesale rates in PostalMate to either Commercial Base or Approved Shipper.

  • Click the button next to Select price group & set wholesale rates.

  • Select the pricing group that applies to you.

  • Click Apply.

Note: You will be charged for postage based on whatever plan you are assigned to, not by what level is selected in PostalMate. How to get to USPS Setup and Endicia Settings

Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup and select the USPS tab.

PostalMate fully supports Lone Star Overnight (LSO), a regional carrier available in Texas, Oklahoma, and some metro areas in New Mexico, Nebraska, Louisiana and Arkansas.

To use LSO, you must do the following:

  • Complete a Premium Service Agreement form and fax it back to PC Synergy.

  • Have an account set up with Lone Star Overnight.

LSO Setup

This is where basic setup for LSO is done in PostalMate.

  • LSO is used in this store: Check this box if you offer LSO.  If left unchecked, LSO will not display.

Set up Label Printer

You must select your label printer in order to print LSO labels. Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Label Settings. Scroll toward the bottom of the list and select your 4x6 label printer for LSO Shipper and set Qty to 1.

See TechNote titled Setting up Lone Star Overnight for detailed instructions on setting up LSO in PostalMate.

How to get to LSO Setup:

Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Settings and select the LSO Setup tab.

Note: LSO Setup will only display in PostalMate if the store zip code entered is within the LSO service area.

What are \"wholesale rates\"?

Wholesale rates represent the actual rates that you pay to the carrier (your cost). These rates will be used as the basis for calculating your profit on PostalMate reports, however setting them in PostalMate will have no impact over how you are actually billed from the carrier(s).

  • If your store does not have any special pricing discounts with a carrier, your wholesale prices equal the published rates for that carrier. This is the way that the rates are supplied in PostalMate.

  • Once youve installed PostalMate, go to PostalMate Settings. From each of the carrier setup pages (i.e., FedEx Express Setup), you can select a Tier (or \"Level\" or \"Rate Program,\" depending on the carrier) that will set your wholesale rates automatically.

  • USPS rates cannot be edited; USPS doesnt offer discounts.

Wholesale rates are one of the four rate levels that PostalMate stores for each carrier service.  The others are published, retail and suggested retail.

This is where you can adjust the rate for carrier Package Drop-Off services.

  • The compensation from the carrier per drop-off transaction is
    fixed amount, regardless of package destination or weight.

  • If the carrier should change the rate for a drop-off service,
    you can change the amount here to match the new rate.

How to set a drop-off compensation rate

  1. Click in the \"compensation\" cell for the desired type.

  2. Enter the amount that the carrier compensates your store for this type.

  3. Enter a \"Retail\" amount if desired.

  4. Select a department where any chargeable items will be mapped to.

  5. Click Save.

UPS Note: All locations participating in the UPS Drop-Off program are required to use the UPS web-based
Access Point (REAP) system to log and report UPS drop-offs.  UPS drop-offs may be recorded in PostalMate but will also need to be recorded in UPS Access Point website for compensation. You may enter your UPS Access Point login credentials in PostalMate drop-off setup and PostalMate can automatically log you into the sitewhen your record a UPS drop-off.  For more information about the UPS drop-off program and/or RPDO, contact your UPS Access Point at 855.404.0585 option 3.

Email notification

Email notification can be set up to be used for drop-offs, and optionally charge for this service.

  1. Enter a retail amount (if desired) and checkmark the box for Email notification enabled.

  2. See Email Notification Settings for information on setting up this feature.

Insurance

Drop-offs can be insured by Shipsurance or RS Package Insurance (both are alternate insurance providers).

  • If Shipsurance or RS Package Insurance are already setup and enabled, simple select the appropriate alternate insurance carrier from the drop-down list.

  • See TechNotes for Shipsurance Setup and/or RS Package Insurance Setup for more information on setting up either alternate insurance carriers in PostalMate.

Taping and Sealing

You have an option to charge for taping and sealing for drop-offs.

  1. Enter the retail amount you wish to charge, and checkmark the box for Taping and Sealing enabled.

  2. Click Save.

Disclaimer

Enter the disclaimer you wish to print on the drop-off receipt.

Receipt Options

  1. Select the receipt printer, or a label printer, from the drop down list.

  2. Select how many copies you wish to print.

  3. Click Save.

How to get to Drop-Off Settings

In PostalMate, choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Drop-Off Settings.

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T00:37:50.894+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-10-14T22:14:22.988+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "deb79e6c-074f-4b70-8c0a-2ee30e05015f", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T00:37:50.894+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": "Settings: Drop-Off", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "jTKGLgBT/Settings-DropOff", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2020-07-27T00:37:50.894+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

This is where basic setup for UPS is done in PostalMate.

UPS in PostalMate: Check this box if you offer UPS; otherwise, leave un-checked, and UPS will not appear on PostalMate screens.

Saturday Pickup: If checked, Saturday Pickup will be offered as an option of the Rate Comparison screen on appropriate days.

UPS Shipper #: Enter you UPS Shipper number here.

UPS Web Services

UPS web services allows you to ship package via the internet as well as carrier commitments, email notification and tracking features. Choose the Register online with UPS button,

  1. Make sure you have an active internet connection.

  2. Review your store information including telephone number and UPS Shipper Number. Click Next.

  3. If you have received a UPS invoice in the past, you may enter the invoice information and click Next.

  4. Read the UPS Technology Agreement. Choose \"Yes, I Do\" a the bottom of the agreement. Click Next.

  5. PostalMate will communicate with the UPS servers in order to register your account with UPS via web services.

Setting Your Wholesale Rates by ASO Incentive Level

\"Wholesale\" rates are the rates that your store pays to UPS these are usually lower than the published (\"list\") rates. If your location is an ASO (Authorized Shipping Outlet), your wholesale rates will be based on \"tiers,\" which are supported in PostalMate. Your FedEx Account Executive should be able to tell you what Tier you store is assigned to (if your location is not an ASO, you can skip these steps).

  1. Click the Select Level and set wholesale rates button. This will take you to a screen where you can select the appropriate tier level from a drop-down list.

  2. Select the \"Level\" button that corresponds to the level assigned to you by UPS.

  3. Click the Apply button. You wholesale rates will be set and saved, according to the selected Level. When this is complete, a message dialog will confirm this. Click OK to return to the UPS setup screen, where the Level will be displayed.

How to get to UPS Setup: Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup and select the UPS tab.

Back to Table of Contents

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-08T04:16:19.114+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-08-11T01:19:13.749+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "6ba36a28-de4b-44fd-af84-9cf9bfc66e27", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-21T05:14:15.828+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": " Settings: UPS Setup", "slug": "Lcgo7MAc/-Settings-UPS-Setup", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2021-01-20T05:14:15.828+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

This is where basic setup for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground is done in PostalMate.

FedEx in PostalMate: Check the box(s) for \"Express enabled\" and/or \"Ground enabled\" if you offer FedEx Express and/or FedEx Ground; otherwise, leave unchecked, and FedEx Express and/or Ground will not appear on PostalMate screens.

Saturday Pickup: If checked, Saturday Pickup will be offered as an option of the Rate Comparison screen on appropriate days. Check the box for Express and Ground as needed.

Setting Your Wholesale Rates by FASC Tier

\"Wholesale\" rates are the rates that your store pays to FedEx these are usually lower than the published (\"list\") rates. If your location is an FASC (FedEx Authorized Ship Center), your wholesale rates will be based on \"tiers,\" which are supported in PostalMate. Your FedEx Account Executive should be able to tell you what Tier you store is assigned to (if your location is not an FASC, you can skip these steps).

  1. Click the Select Express Tier for wholesale rates button. This will take you to a screen where you can choose the appropriate FedEx Express tier from a drop-down list.

  2. Select the \"Tier\" number that corresponds to your stores assigned Tier.

  3. Click the Apply button. You wholesale rates will be set and saved, according to the selected Tier. When this is complete, a message dialog will confirm this. Click OK to return to the FedEx Express Setup screen, where the Tier will be displayed.

  4. Repeat above steps to select your FedEx Ground tier level.

Internet Shipping Setup

To use PostalMates FedEx internet shipments features (for Express and Ground):

  1. If you havent already, submit a Premium Services Order to PC Synergy.

  2. Click the Subscribe online with FedEx button. This initiates the process of setting your store up on FedEx servers.

  3. Enter your FedEx account number and double-check your store information and click the Send button. This sends your subscription request to FedEx electronically. If accepted, you can begin shipping very soon thereafter.

How to get to FedEx Setup: Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup and select the FedEx tab.

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T00:27:50.313+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-08-11T01:12:28.661+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "4db21422-3c1e-4561-b70e-aa21ef6029b3", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T00:27:50.313+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": " Settings: FedEx Express Setup", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "zcLBj97c/-Settings-FedEx-Express-Setup", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2021-01-28T00:27:50.313+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

This is where basic setup for OnTrac is done in PostalMate.

OnTrac in PostalMate: Check the \"enabled\" box if you offer OnTrac. If left unchecked, OnTrac will not display. If you havent already, submit a Premium Services Order to PC Synergy.

Verify OnTrac account online

  • Choose the box next to \"Verify OnTrac account online\"

  • Enter your OnTrac account number and password.

  • Click OK.

  • If the verification is successful the status will update to Account verified.

Wholesale Rates

  1. Choose the box next to Set or import wholesale rates.

  2. From the drop-down list, select either Use Published rates or Import custom rates from file.

    1. Import custom rates from file:  OnTrac provides a specifically-formatted .txt file that contains your custom (discounted rates).

    2. Next to File: click the ... box to browse to the file and click Apply to import the rates into PostalMate.

How to get to OnTrac Setup: Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier
Setup and select the OnTrac tab.

Note: OnTrac will only display in PostalMate if the store zip code entered is within the OnTrac service area.

Most shipping carriers (UPS, FedEx Express, DHL, LSO, and Spee-Dee) reserve the right to add a \"fuel surcharge\" to their rates. This allows them to dynamically alter the rates they charge to accommodate changes in their operating costs, which are largely tied to the cost of fuel. The amount of the surcharge may change at any time without the carrier having to go through a major rate change.

PostalMate stores these fuel surcharge percentages.  When rates are being calculated for the Rate Comparison screen, these percentages are factored into the displayed rates. You can apply a different percentage to your retail rates (versus wholesale) if you like, so that you can in effect \"mark up\" (or discount) the surcharge.

Fuel surcharges are updated automatically

If you have an open internet connection, PC Synergy can keep fuel surcharges current for your PostalMate system automatically.  

Setting your retail markups

Optionally. you can mark up the fuel surcharges by adding an additional percentage amounts to whatever percentages the carriers charge.

  1. Go to PostalMate Settings

  2. Choose Surcharge Rates from the left pane.

  3. Enter the desired additional amount for each carrier.

  4. Click Save.

This amount will be added regardless of what the carrier charges, so you don't need to change it when the carrier changes. Example:  If the wholesale (carrier) amount is 9.5%, and you've entered a markup of 2.0%, PostalMate will add a total of 11.5% to the retail shipping amounts in Rate Comparison.  If the wholesale (carrier) amount changed to 10.0%, PostalMate would then add a total of 12.0%

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T00:31:11.393+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-08-13T04:17:55.692+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "734cb22e-76a6-467f-8ec2-2cd33e4e6015", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T00:31:11.393+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": " Fuel Surcharge", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "aczyyG7c/-Fuel-Surcharge", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2021-01-28T00:31:11.393+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

This option gives you control over which carrier services are available for shipments in the Rate Comparison window, and how they are organized.

  • If youd like only certain services available for shipments, this is where to specify them.

  • Carrier services checked here will be available for selection in the Rate Comparison screen, provided they are valid for the shipment's package weight, dimensions and destination.

  • If you can't find a specific service here, then it is not in the system.

  • You may change the names on the tabs to suit your needs. The changes you make to the tab names are duplicated in the Rate Comparison display.

  • Each tab contains a list of all the carrier services that are in the system. By selecting (checking) the services, naming and enabling the tabs, you determine the way that carrier services are displayed in your system.

  • To enable a tab in the Rate Comparison display, the \"Tab Active\" option must be checked. You can enable up to all six tabs.

How to set up carrier services for your system

Note for PostalMate network users: These settings will apply to all workstations; the setup must be done on the Master.

  1. From the main menu, go to Tools > PostalMate Settings > Shipping Settings, then click on the \"Service Display\" tab.

  2. Click either Generic or Carrier-branded, as appropriate (these categories have separate settings, for maximum flexibility).

  3. Select the desired tab.

  4. Optionally, you can enter a custom name in the \"Name on Tab\" box. This name will appear on the corresponding tab in the Rate Comparison window.

  5. You can make any tab (except the first one) invisible in Rate Comparison by simply unchecking the \"Tab active\" box here.

  6. Under \"Service to Display\", select and/or clear the services for the corresponding Rate Comparison tab, according to your shipping needs.

  7. Services with check marks will be made available to the corresponding Rate Comparison tab.

  8. Services without check marks will not be available.

  9. Click OK to save changes.

About the tabs: UPS, FedEx, USPS, DHL, Multi-Carriers, and Other

  • UPS, FedEx, FedEx Ground, DHL and USPS are called \"system carriers\" because their rate and service databases are provided in PostalMate.
    The default Rate Comparison settings for these carriers are included in the Display of Services tabs.

  • The Display of Services default tab names are: UPS, FedEx, USPS, DHL and Multi-Carriers.

  • You may change these names, if you wish, to suit the needs of your shipping environment.

  • Any combination of listed carrier services may be selected on the tabs. This allows you to map services to the tabs by carrier name, service type (Parcel or Carrier Pack), or according to your own custom setup.

  • The Multi-Carriers tab is suggested for general mail and parcel operations, with all services checked. This way, you can compare all services available to a shipment and select the desired serviceon one tab.  

Note: As per UPS rules, UPS services cannot display on a tab with other carriers. UPS services must be set up and selected on its own tab.

  • The \"Other\" tab may be used for an \"Additional\" carrier or your own custom Rate Comparison tab. Here again, the choice is yours.

  • Remember, only services with checkmarks will be available to the Rate Comparison window, and only if the \"Tab Active\" option is checked.

How to get to there: From the PostalMate main menu bar, select Tools > PostalMate Settings > Shipping Settings , and then choose the Service Display tab.

Back to Table of Contents

This is where you select which labels will print when packages are shipped. PostalMate supports several label printer models (all made by Zebra). Label setup must be done on each PostalMate workstation.

See our Hardware Requirements for a list of supported label printers and supported connection options.

Adding your label printer(s) on this computer

To use a label printer in PostalMate, install the appropriate Zebra Designer driver for your printer. Most USB Zebra label printers are plug-n-play and will automatically install the appropriate driver when plugged into a computer.

To install a driver manually, use the CD that came with your printer or use the following links for the specified printers.

  • Zebra 2844, GK420D, GC420D - http://www.zebra.com/us/en/support-downloads.html

  • Zebra 450 - http://www.ups.com/content/us/en/resources/ship/create/labels/technical.html

  • Zebra 500 or 505 - http://www.fedex.com/us/ship-manager/software/resources/support/printer drivers.html

For more detailed information, see TechNote titled Label Printer Setup.

Enabling labels

Each label that you wish to enable must be assigned to a printer, and a quantity of 1 or more must be entered.

  1. In the table of labels on the screen, click on the label to select it. A sample of the label will appear on the screen.

  2. In the \"Printer name\" column, select the printer to assign.

  3. In the \"Qty\" column, enter the number of labels you want printed for each shipment or transaction. Entering \"0\" will disable this label from printing. Note: To protect against fraud, the shipping carriers do not allow multiple copies of shipping labels; therefore the maximum for these is \"1\".

  4. To test, click on the button next to \"Test printer assignment for selected label\".

  5. Repeat for each label you wish to set up.

  6. Click Save.

How to get to Label Settings:

In PostalMate, choose Tools > PostalMate Settings and select Label Settings on the left pane.

The eUpdates feature is designed to keep important aspects of your PostalMate system up-to-date with little or no effort on your part, via the internet.  Currently, eUpdates is used only for updating fuel surcharge percentages from the shipping carriers  An open internet connection is required
for use of this feature.

Heres a basic summary of the eUpdate process:

  1. PC Synergy staff uploads eUpdates to PC Synergy servers.  When appropriate, PC Synergy will put new eUpdates on its servers (the same ones used for internet shipping).  For example, on or before the first of each month, eUpdates for new fuel surcharges will be uploaded.

  2. PostalMate downloads eUpdates from server. On a daily basis, PostalMate will check PC Synergy servers for new eUpdates (this is automatic, so you dont need to do anything), and download them if there are any.  Normally the download will take only a second or two, and it will happen in the background without disrupting other PostalMate operations.

  3. You click a button to run eUpdates in PostalMate.   A 'run date' is associated with each eUpdate.  When one or more eUpdates are ready to run, youll be notified on the New Shipment screen.   At your convenience, just click the  Run eUpdates\" button.  A typical eUpdate takes less than one second to run.  If you don't run an eUpdate on the effective run date, the indication will remain on New Shipment screen until it is run.

\"Additional Handling\" is a generic term refers to a surcharge that shipping carriers may impose in either of the following cases:

  • A certain package dimension exceeds a predefined maximum.

  • An article is being shipped that is not encased in a standard container.

Note:  DHL uses the term \"Excess Dimensions Fee\" for the first case, and \"Exception Handling\" for the second case, both in place of \"Additional Handling.\"

When based on dimensions

Additional Handling may be applied if a single dimension exceeds a maximum established by the carrier. The exact rules vary between carriers.

PostalMate applies the charge automatically, based on the package dimensions either entered by you, or calculated as part of a ProPack Later transaction; no special procedure is required by you. On the Rate Comparison screen, the appropriate dollar amount for Additional Handling is automatically added to the shipping charges.

When you select (highlight) a service for which Additional Handling is being applied, youll see a visual indicator, which includes the dollar amount of the surcharge, to the right of the weight display. If its being combined with a Delivery Area Surcharge, Additional Handling will be designated as \"A.H.\" to save space.

When based on the container

Additional Handling may be applied if the article being shipped is either not in a standard container (i.e., a cardboard box) or is not in a container at all (for example, when shipping a tire). The exact rules vary between carriers.

Because PostalMate cannot \"see\" the article being shipped, you must identify such instances yourself. When you ship a package that qualifies according to the rules, click the button labeled \"Article will not be encased in standard container\" in the Package Dimensions dialog. Once youve done this, PostalMate will apply the Additional Handling surcharge, if appropriate, for the selected service in Rate Comparison. There will be the same visual indicator as described above.

Setting rates for Additional Handling

You have control over what you charge to your customers for Surcharges (the retail rate), regardless of what the carrier charges to you (the wholesale rate). This is done from PostalMate Settings, on the \"Surcharge Rates\" page.

Carrier rules for Additional Handling

Each carrier has its own specific rules about if and when Additional Handling  is applied.  The varying rules are built into PostalMate so that you don't need to have them memorized.  This information can normally be found in the service guide and/or website for each of the shipping carriers.

Back to Table of Contents

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T21:35:09.761+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-11-19T22:47:57.272+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "b2294332-f661-4790-8d97-bafc6472b62b", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T21:35:09.761+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": " Display of Services", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "cEBBL6gi/-Display-of-Services", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2020-07-27T21:35:09.761+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

There are a variety of ways that PostalMate makes sure that the proper rates are displayed and used. An increasingly important factor in rating is package dimensions. In fact, in many cases dimensions can make the actual package weight irrelevant in determining shipping charges.

When you enter package dimensions, PostalMate checks the rules that apply to each carrier service and automatically applies them to the rating and availability for all displayed carrier services on the Rate Comparison screen, as appropriate. If a carrier service cell is clicked, any applicable special rating or availability status will be displayed on screen. The broad categories are:

  • Oversize

  • Dimensional Weight

  • Additional Handling

  • Unacceptable

Oversize

Oversize is sometimes invoked when the size of a package is relatively disproportionate to its weight, which in turn affects the rate because the cost of transporting an article is partly based on the amount of space it consumes. Oversize is typically used only with ground services, but in some cases is applies to express/air services also.  In general, the carriers are obsoleting most Oversize rules for Ground and using
dimensional weight instead (see below).

Generally, depending on the size of the package, the oversize rate will be used; in some case, it will also result in an additional flat surcharge, which may be substantial. Depending on the carrier, these surcharges go by various names, such as Large Package Surcharge, Oversize Surcharge, or Excess Limits
Fee.

When applicable, PostalMate will automatically add the appropriate amount in Rate Comparison, and \"Oversize\" will be indicated on the screen.

Dimensional Weight

Dimensional weight (\"dim weight\") is similar to Oversize in the sense that dimensions take precedence over weight, however the calculations are completely different. Dim weight is typically used with air services, both domestic and international, as well as ground services. USPS services currently do not use
dim weight.

Dim weight is generally calculated by multiplying the packages length, width and height, then dividing the total by either 166 (domestic) or 139 (international). The result is then compared with the actual weight, and the greater number is used for rating. Some ground services apply dimensional weight
when the dimensions are greater than 5184 cubic inches. This all happens automatically in PostalMate when dimensions are entered.

When dim weight is applied to a selected service on the Rate Comparison screen, the status bar will indicate so, and will display the billable weight, and the formula used. For example: \"Using Dimensional Weight: 30 (LxWxH/166)\".

Unacceptable

\"N/A\" will appear on the screen in place of a retail rate if the entered dimensions exceed that allowable for the displayed carrier service. For international destinations, each country has its own requirements, all of which are accounted for in PostalMate. When such an affected service is selected, the status bar will display \"Unacceptable: Exceeds maximum dimensions.\"

You can track your FedEx, UPS, DHL, USPS and LSO packages online right from PostalMate.   

Requirements  

  • You must be signed up for PC Synergy Premium Services for tracking FedEx or UPS from PostalMate. For UPS you must be also registered for UPS Online Tools, which can be done from PostalMate. For USPS, you must be using the Endicia Interface.

  • Any package you wish to track must have been shipped via a carrier service for which the tracking # was generated automatically. If you used an airbill or entered a tracking number manually, use the carrier's website for tracking.

How to track a package

  1. From the New Shipment screen, click on the \"Everyday Tools\" button (the one with the Swiss Army knife icon).

  2. Click the \"Find Package\" button, then enter the desired search criteria and click \"Next.\" Youll see the Package Find /\"Matching Packages\" screen.

  3. Click on the desired package, then click on the \"Track\" button. (This button will be disabled if the package cannot be tracked using PostalMate.) PostalMate will perform the appropriate online tracking operation.

Note: You can always return to the Package History screen, go to Package Status tab, and click the \"Update\" button. This will connect to the carrier and re-track.

Back to Table of Contents
