The On-line Help is your main information resource for PostalMate system setups and operations. It functions as your primary PostalMate Users Manual.

Using the Help button

Click on the Help button to view information about the current windows feature(s) and corresponding procedures.

Getting Help from the main menu

  1. From PostalMate's main menu, go to Help > PostalMate Users Manual.

  2. Choose the Contents, Index, or Search tab for the search method you wish to use.

For additional PostalMate information resources, see:

  • Searching for Specific Help

  • PC Synergy Customer Support

This is where you can record \"Drop-Off\" shipments for FedEx, DHL, UPS*, USPS, and FedEx Smart Post. 

  • Drop-Off packages are those that are pre-paid for a specific carrier and service, or will be charged to an account other than your stores.

  • They are called drop-offs because people just drop them off at your store without getting involved in a shipping transaction.

  • The carrier will pay a flat fee for each Drop-Off package processed by your store.

Recording a Drop-Off package

  1. From the PostalMate main screen, choose Ship/Mail and then select Drop-off with carrier label.

  2. Scan (or type in) the bar code on the pre-addressed shipping label (it should already be on the
    package).  If entered/scanned correctly, the carrier will auto-select.  If you have more than one drop-off for this customer, proceed to scan in the next drop-off(s).

  3. Select or add a customer if desired by clicking the Customer button.

  4. Select or add a Ship To if desired by clicking the Ship To button.

  5. Enter the Contents description if desired.

  6. Choose any additional options you would like to include with the drop off.

    1. Email Notification: The price can be changed when clicking the email Notification button. (Email notification for shipment delivery must be enabled to use this feature. The email process begins at the time of carrier
      pickup.

    2. Taping and Sealing: The price can be changed when clicking the Taping and Sealing button.

  7. Click Record. The receipt will begin to print at this time. A receipt for the drop-off shipment will print to your receipt printer.  If any charges were included with the shipment, these may be carried over to CashMate using the POS Register button from the main PostalMate screen.

View / void drop-off transactions

Choose the Other Activities button from the main shipping screen and select Void Shipment.  You can void drop-off transactions prior to carrier pickup.

*Note:  UPS drop-off's can be scanned into PostalMate's drop-off screen. However, all locations participating in the UPS Drop-Off program are required to use the UPS web based Access Point (REAP) system to log and report UPS drop-offs.  Scanning UPS drop-off's in PostalMate will bring up the UPS Access Point screen automatically so that you can scan each drop off there as well.  For more information about the UPS drop-off program and/or REAP, contact UPS Access point at 855.404.0585 option 3.

How to get to the Package Drop-Off dialog:

From the New Shipment window, select the select Ship/Mail and then the Drop-off with carrier label button. Or, from the PostalMate main menu, choose File > New Shipment > Drop-Off.

Back to Table of Contents

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-29T21:38:07.142+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-11-26T04:13:43.746+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "67f789ad-4816-4dd1-a1a5-89cc2bb13539", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-29T21:38:07.142+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": " Package Drop-Off", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "i6EEpd4T/-Package-DropOff", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2020-07-27T21:38:07.142+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

DHL shipments can be processed online in PostalMate. Customs information is entered into PostalMate and a ramp-ready label is generated, along with a commercial invoice.

Shipping DHL International Online

  1. Choose or enter a customer (including the customers phone number) for a DHL International  Shipment.

  2. The Ship To must include a full address including City, State (province, district or other division) and  possible postal code, as well as a phone number.

  3. Once on the rate comparison screen, select DHL Express Worldwide. (you will be prompted if any of the above is missing.)  Click Next.

  4. The Customs Information screen allows two options:

    1. Documents:  For Document only shipments. No Customs forms are needed. One 4x6 label will print.

    2. Goods: Select weather the item is a Gift or Not a Gift. Choosing Not a Gift will allow you to select one of the following from the drop down list: Commercial  Sample, Sale, Repair/Returned Goods, Other.  Select the appropriate item for your shipment and click Next.  

Fill out the Customs information and choose Next to get to the Package Details screen. The Contents description is required to finalize your shipment. The commercial invoice will appear on your screen and default to print four copies.  Select the printer destination (8 1/2 x 11 printer) and choose Print. 

Two 4x6 shipment labels will also print. One label is for your package, and the other label is for your driver.

Where to Set Up DHL in PostalMate

Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup > DHL Express

Back to Table of Contents

", "owner": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "arianna@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Arianna", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModified": "2020-01-28T23:59:35.451+0000", "dateCreated": "2018-08-08T20:48:42.872+0000", "collection": { "color": "#2196f3", "id": "5a9babdc-e683-4e8b-94dd-16a5e4a5085a", "publicCardsEnabled": true, "roiEnabled": false, "collectionType": "INTERNAL", "name": "Help Topics - External" }, "id": "1ab6ec9c-5ee4-486f-8bd1-bb597e8f6a70", "boards": [ { "id": "3ba0bc55-fa51-4d86-8b19-f0bfaf8f59f5", "title": "PostalMate Help Topics", "items": [], "numberOfFacts": 0 } ], "lastVerified": "2020-01-28T23:59:35.451+0000", "lastVerifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "lastModifiedBy": { "status": "ACTIVE", "email": "daryan@pcsynergy.com", "firstName": "Daryan", "lastName": "Tariqi" }, "htmlContent": true, "shareStatus": "PUBLIC", "preferredPhrase": "DHL Internet Shipping (overview)", "publicLinkAllowed": true, "slug": "jcKj5RKc/DHL-Internet-Shipping-overview", "verificationState": "TRUSTED", "cardType": "CARD", "nextVerificationDate": "2021-01-27T23:59:35.451+0000", "highlightedTitleContent": [], "highlightedBodyContent": [], "highlightedTagContent": [] }, { "content": "

This is where you can add or edit carrier information. The \"Basic\" steps for adding a carrier are given below.

Adding a carrier

  1. From the PostalMate menu, choose Edit > Shipping Carrier.

  2. Click Add.

  3. Enter the additional carriers Full name. Example: \"Gold Star Parcel Delivery\".

  4. Enter the carriers Screen name. This would be an abbreviated name, up to 8 characters, that will appear on the Rate Comparison screen, and elsewhere that space is limited. Example: \"GoldStar\".

  5. Add any Add-Ons offered by this carrier: Next to the \"Add-Ons\" list box, click on the Add button. The \"Add Add-On Service\" dialog will then display. Fill in the requested information and click OK. Repeat this step for each add-on to be included.

  6. Add the shipping services (i.e., \"Ground\") offered by this carrier: Next to the \"Services\" list box, click on the \"Add\" button. The \"Add Carrier Service\" dialog will then display. Fill in the information and choose the options that you wish to include.  Click OK. Repeat this step for each service to be included with the added carrier.

  7. Click OK.

Note: After the carrier is added to the system, all wholesale and retail rates for the added services must be manually entered in  Rate Settings. If the added carrier services are \"zone-rated\", you will need to add each zone (and its rates) as a separate carrier service.

Rates for \"Add-Ons\" may be entered in the Add Add-On Service dialog or in the \"Add-Ons\" rate settings.

Editing a carrier

  1. From the PostalMate menu, choose Edit > Shipping Carrier.

  2. Click Edit.

  3. Make the desired changes and click OK.

Deactivating an unused carrier

Any carrier in PostalMate that is not used in your store can be \"deactivated,\" which
basically means that that carrier and its services will not display in most areas of the program, including the Rate Comparison screen, rate-setting screens and the Carrier Pickup screen. The carrier remains in the database, so it can be reactivated later if desired.

Deactivating a carrier can improve the speed of Rate Comparison.

  1. From the PostalMate menu, choose Edit > Shipping Carrier.

  2. Click Edit.

  3. Place a check in the \"This carrier is not used\" box.

  4. Click OK.

Back to Table of Contents

This is the process of registering your FedEx account and PostalMate system with the FedEx data center. This is a requirement for internet shipping.

Before you begin the subscription process, you must have a live internet connection, meaning it must be open at the time you perform the steps below.

  1. From the PostalMate main menu, select Tools > PostalMate Settings, and go to the \"FedEx Express Setup\" page.

  2. Click on the \"Subscribe online\" button. The FedEx Subscription screen will display.

  3. Review your stores information and make any necessary changes.

  4. Choose the Send button. This will transmit your subscription request to the FedEx data center. If the subscription is successful, the data center will send a response to PostalMate, and FedEx internet shipping will be enabled on your system.

Back to Table of Contents

Set DHL Rate Program

The DHL Rate Programs are available only to DASC's. Contact DHL for more information.

  • Verify with DHL the Rate program that applies to your store.

  • Select the appropriate rate program level from the drop down list and choose \"Apply\".

  • This will set your DHL wholesale rates to the level selected.

What are \"wholesale rates\"?

Wholesale rates represent the actual rates that you pay to the carrier (your cost). These rates will be used as the basis for calculating your profit on PostalMate reports, however setting them in PostalMate will have no impact over how you are actually billed from the carrier(s).

  • If your store does not have any special pricing discounts with a carrier, your wholesale prices equal the published rates for that carrier. This is the way that the rates are supplied in PostalMate.

How to get to the Set DHL Wholesale Rates screen

Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup. Choose the DHL Express tab. Select the button \"Select Rate Program for wholesale rates\".

Back to Table of Contents

Set FASC Express Tier levels

The FASC Tier levels are available for FedEx Authorized Shipping Centers. Contact your FedEx representative or log-on to your FASCNET account to find out what tier level applies to your store.

  • Select the appropriate tier level from the drop down list and choose \"Apply\".

  • This will set your FedEx Express wholesale rates to level selected.

 

What are \"wholesale rates\"?

Wholesale rates represent the actual rates that you pay to the carrier (your cost). These rates will be used as the basis for calculating your profit on PostalMate reports, however setting them in PostalMate will have no impact over how you are actually billed from the carrier(s).

  • If your store does not have any special pricing discounts with a carrier, your wholesale prices equal the published rates for that carrier. This is the way that the rates are supplied in PostalMate.

How to get to the Set FedEx Wholesale Rates screen:

Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup and choose the FedEx tab. Select the button \"Select Express Tier for wholesale rates\".

Set ASO Incentive levels

The ASO Incentive levels are available for UPS Authorized Shipping Outlets. Contact your UPS representative to find out which incentive level applies to your store.

  • Select the appropriate incentive level from the drop down list and choose \"Apply\".

  • This will set your UPS wholesale rates to level selected.

Set ASO Custom Discounts

You may have custom negotiated discounts for UPS in lieu of a traditional incentive level.

  • Use the drop-down arrow below \"Discount program\" and choose \"Custom\".

  • For each \"Service Type\" enter in the discount level percentage given to you by UPS.  

  • Make sure that each \"Service Type\" has a discount percentage entered and click \"Apply\" to save your settings.

  • This will set your UPS wholesale rates using the custom discounts entered for each service type.

 

What are \"wholesale rates\"?

Wholesale rates represent the actual rates that you pay to the carrier (your cost). These rates will be used as the basis for calculating your profit on PostalMate reports, however setting them in PostalMate will have no impact over how you are actually billed from the carrier(s).

  • If your store does not have any special pricing discounts with a carrier, your wholesale prices equal the published rates for that carrier. This is the way that the rates are supplied in PostalMate.

How to get to the Set UPS Wholesale Rates screen: Choose Tools > PostalMate Settings > Carrier Setup and choose the UPS tab. Select the button \"Select Level and set wholesale rates\".

This screen allows you to edit existing alternate insurance companies and add new alternate insurance companies. 

  • Shipsurance defaults are included in PostalMate. It is recommended to not edit or make changes to Shipsurance unless directed by PC Synergy or Shipsurance.

  • RS Package insurance defaults are included in PostalMate. It is recommended to not edit or make changes to RS Package insurance defaults unless directed by PC Synergy or RSA.

  • Endicia insurance is listed, but does not allow editing.

  • Any user-added alternate insurance company will be listed here.

Company

  • Choose Edit to edit an existing alternate insurance company.

  • Choose Add to add a new alternate insurance company.

Add/Edit Insurance Company

  • Below Reference, add the name of the new alternate insurance company.

  • Place a checkmark next to Enabled.

  • Choose Add to add a new rate group for this company.

  • Choose Edit to edit and existing rate group.

Rate Groups

Your alternate insurance company may have different rates for different services (i.e. different rates for domestic and international). Each rate group should be given a name.

  • Checkmark the box Enabled to use this rate group.

  • Enter the Maximum amount the alternate company allows.

  • Enter the amount for approval that the alternate company requires.

  • Enter the ranges for DVU for each rating group.  (example: $.01 -$5000.00). If your alternate company has different rates for different ranges, you can add ranges as needed, making sure there is no overlap between ranges.

  • Rate Groups can be edited as necessary.

Follow instructions in the TechNote titled Adding Alternate Insurance for more detailed instructions on adding an alternate insurance company. 

How to get to \"Alternate Insurance Company\": From the PostalMate main menu, select Tools > PostalMate Settings and select Insurance Settings on the left pane. Choose Companies and Rate Groups.

Back to Table of Contents

This is where you can choose between shipping transaction styles (Pro Ship and Wizard Ship) and set shipping transaction prompts to display (or not).

Are you using Pro Ship or Wizard Ship?

PostalMate offers two shipping transaction styles to choose from: Pro Ship and Wizard Ship.

  • For a more detailed discussion, see the Help topic: Pro Ship vs. Wizard Ship.

  • The Wizard Ship mode is recommended if you are new to PostalMate.

Pro Ship defaults

You may set Pro Ship defaults (preferences) here.

  • These options toggle the Select/Add Ship To button settings in the \"Additional Information\" prompt.

  • Select from database This default makes it easier to select an existing Ship To from the database in Pro Ship transactions.

  • Add new addresses to database Check the box if you want this enabled in \"Additional Information\". This default makes it easier to add new Ship To's in Pro Ship transactions.

Automatic Prompts: The Basic Idea

Automatic prompts make it easier for all users to enter required information and make selections. They also can help you streamline shipping transactionsyou may wish to select only the prompts that you actually use at your store.

  • The prompts that are selected here will automatically display in Generic packaging and Carrier branded packaging transactions.

  • Prompts may be selected for either the Wizard Ship or Pro Ship transaction style.

  • Automatic prompts remind the user to enter the necessary shipment information, helping to ensure that all data required by the carrier and your store will be recorded in the system.

To change a shipping prompt setting:

  1. In the \"Enabled auto-prompts\" area:

  2. If you want a prompt to display, check the box.

  3. If you do not want a prompt to display, remove the check mark.

  4. Click on OK to save the settings.

How to get to the Automatic Prompts dialog: From the PostalMate main menu bar, select Tools > PostalMate Settings > Shipping Settings, and then the Prompts tab.

Back to Table of Contents
